sentence.Network_en: He was nobler than his neighbours.
sentence.Network_cn: 他比他的邻居出身高贵.

sentence.Network_en: He began to have a nobler opinion of himself than ever before.
sentence.Network_cn: 他从没有像现在这样感到自己是个不平凡的人.

sentence.Network_en: A shy failure is nobler than an immodest success.
sentence.Network_cn: 一个羞赧的失败比一个骄傲的成功还要高贵.

the things we are going through are either making us sweeter , better , and nobler men and women , or they are making us more critical and fault-finding , and more insistent on our own way .我们现在所经历的事要么使我们变成更甜蜜、美好和高贵的男人或者女人，要么让我们变得更加严峻、到处找碴，偏行己路。
we only need to persist in spiritual cultivation , and then we will be increasingly able to forsake these material things , and become nobler people .我们只要继续修行,就会越来越放下这些物质的东西,成为越来越高雅的人。
people think that the purple is the nobler colour .人们认为紫色是高贵的颜色。

entry.def: If you say that someone is a noble person, you admire and respect them because they are unselfish and morally good.

example.ex: He was an upright and noble man who was always willing to help in any way he could...
example.tran: 他是一个正直高尚的人，总是愿意尽其所能帮助他人。

example.ex: I wanted so much to believe he was pure and noble.
example.tran: 我非常愿意相信他是纯洁高尚的。

entry.tran: (想法、目标、行动等)高尚的,崇高的
entry.def: If you say that something is a noble idea, goal, or action, you admire it because it is based on high moral principles.

example.ex: He had implicit faith in the noble intentions of the Emperor...
example.tran: 他对皇帝陛下高尚的动机深信不疑。

example.ex: We'll always justify our actions with noble sounding theories...
example.tran: 我们总会用听起来非常高尚的理论为我们的行动辩护。

entry.tran: 壮观的;宏伟的;卓越的;优质的
entry.def: If you describe something as noble, you think that its appearance or quality is very impressive, making it superior to other things of its type.

example.ex: ...the great parks with their noble trees.

entry.def: Noble means belonging to a high social class and having a title.

example.ex: Although he was of noble birth he lived as a poor man.
example.tran: 虽然他出身贵族，却过着穷人的日子。

entry.def: In former times, people who belonged to a high social class and had titles such as 'Baron' or 'Duke' were referred to as nobles .

example.ex: More and more nobles made Moscow their home during Catherine's reign.
example.tran: 在叶卡捷琳娜大帝统治时期，越来越多的贵族移居莫斯科。

auth_sentence.content: But let it be through something nobler than petulance.
auth_sentence.res_content: But let it be through something nobler than petulance.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But let it be through something nobler than petulance.

auth_sentence.content: But, in France, one is supposed to be motivated by nobler or more frivolous purposes.
auth_sentence.res_content: But, in France, one is supposed to be motivated by nobler or more frivolous purposes.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But, in France, one is supposed to be motivated by nobler or more frivolous purposes.
